alert.note: Alert for Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 7:01PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Judith Basin, west central Fergus and southeastern Chouteau Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 700 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Hobson to 6 miles northeast of Stanford. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Denton, Danvers, Coffee Creek, Moccasin and Benchland. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 49 and 54. Highway 191 between mile markers 7 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for central and north central Montana.
